job_description:
Location: Onsite at stadiums within a 2hr radius of Amsterdam
Contract: Consultant, Part-Time
Salary: Up to €180 per day
Start Date: Immediate
We are recruiting to fill Match Assistant roles within our expanding operations in UEFA Football. This is an exciting opportunity to work at the forefront of sports technology as part of a dedicated and dynamic team.
The role involves the setup and operation of our systems on-site at football stadiums throughout Europe for various football competitions, including (but not limited to) Champions League, Europa League and international European Qualification matches.
Working day expectations:
Match Day -> Arrival up to 7 hours pre-Kick Off
Match Day -> End of day up to 2 hours post game completion
There are also varied needs during the setup day/s which may require the consultants to be present on the day/s before match day.
The role requires the consultant to be flexible with work hours depending on the needs of the onsite team

We are looking for committed and passionate people that are willing, and able to commit to all UEFA matches in given stadiums. This is in order to provide the team with consistency throughout the competitions. Please consider that this work is likely to be midweek, Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday on most occasions. Refer to the UEFA calendar (https://www.uefa.com/returntoplay/news/027c-16dee2d0b98f-a5040858c501-1000-2023-european-football-calendar/) to see more details of when fixtures may be.
We will equip you with the technical training, support and full exposure to our systems to perform your match day tasks but also encourage development and progression to help make an impact on what we do. Working as a Match Operations Assistant, is a great entry level route into full time employment with Hawk-Eye Innovations ltd.
Please attach your CV in English.
Key Responsibilities
It is important to note that Match Operations Assistants have various responsibilities that will depend on the role assigned to them. In most cases, a maximum of two of the listed responsibilities below would be assigned per match:
Set up the medical system
Run cabling
Take the Medical Tablets to these positions
Launch the software
Troubleshoot issues with the hardware and associated software
Interact professionally with and provide support to the medical teams who use the system
Set up the audio system
Run cabling
Test the audio units
Troubleshoot issues with the hardware and associated software
Interact professionally with the Match Officials that will be using the audio system during the game
Working with the Electronic Performance and Tracking Systems (EPTS) Team Lead to set up EPTS
Lineup cameras (likely to include working at height, on ladders on on stadium catwalks)
Coordinate with the EPTS Team Lead to troubleshoot any issues with hardware or software
Set up / Operate the Referee Review Area Monitor (RRA)
Run cabling
Test functionality of RRA monitor and backup systems
Troubleshoot issues with the hardware and associated software
Raising of the RRA into position during pre-match tests and during the game when required
Other Responsibilities:
Contribute as part of the team setting up goal-line and video review systems
Conducting pre-match checks of the systems in accordance with standard procedures
Liaising with football officials, stadium/club personnel, match officials and host broadcasters both on-site and remotely
Monitoring and operating the system during the match
Organising your logistics for travelling between stadiums locations as and when required
Skills, Knowledge and Expertise
ESSENTIAL:
Bright and enterprising with excellent organisational, analytical and problem-solving skills
Proactive, responsible attitude and ability to work on your own initiative with minimum supervision
Time management skills and ability to work in a high pressure, procedural, live broadcast environment
Ability to liaise with clients and customers in a professional and approachable manner with attention to good communication.
High proficiency in the English language required
Able to adapt to flexible working conditions with irregular working hours
PREFERRED:
A technical background, ideally in IT or Broadcast
An interest in sport and/or sports analysis, ideally with a good knowledge of football and the rules of the game
Experience working with VT/replay technology desirable, or live event / technical production
Prepared to travel locally and, if required, further afield in Europe
Driving licence preferred
Benefits
A high-autonomy role with real exposure to the forefront of the sports officiating and broadcasting world
The opportunity to experience some of the highest-profile sporting events around the globe
Access to some of the most intelligent, innovative and driven people in our industry
About Hawk-Eye Innovations
About Hawk-Eye

Hawk-Eye Innovations have been at the forefront of sports officiating and broadcast enhancement technology since 2001. The world’s biggest sporting events trust Hawk-Eye to make the right call when it matters most.
Hawk-Eye’s vision-processing, video replay and creative graphic technologies make sport fairer, safer, more engaging and better informed. Our innovations are constantly changing the face of sports officiating, production, content management, and fan engagement in every sport.
Hawk-Eye Innovations form a key part of the Sony Sports Innovations Group with a shared mission to deliver best-in-class officiating, broadcast and digital solutions to the sports world.

Our Values
At Hawk-Eye Innovations, our three core values underpin our success, ensuring that we continue to be a leading innovator in sports technology on a global scale. Our business is filled with exceptional talent that helps to ensure that the World’s biggest sporting events trust us to make the right call when it matters the most. We deliver on this by ensuring that:
WE ARE BRAVE
Confident in solving almost impossible problems, pioneering and ambitious for our clients and for ourselves. We are bold leaders in the industry, driven by possibilities and striving with pace and energy. We understand our risks and love the challenge.
WE ARE OWNERS
Our business is our own; we feel every win, and especially the losses. We take pride in excellence and trust ourselves to do what’s right, relentlessly. We make decisions like owners, with endeavour and entrepreneurialism. We are serious about what we do, and have fun whilst doing it.
WE ARE INCLUSIVE
We are one team; a community that’s connected and open. No secrets, no politics, just honesty and respect. We value diverse thinking, and diverse people - this helps us innovate. We treat people as people, who are all integral to our success and we celebrate as one.


Diversity and Inclusion
Our commitment to diversity and inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and experience drives us forward every day. We celebrate differences. We encourage different opinions and approaches to be heard, and then we come together and build.

Our response to COVID 19
During this time Team Hawk-Eye is working in a hybrid manner for all of our Head Office roles. Our operational teams are working onsite, Pioneering & Inspiring Change in Sport every day!
Head Office Teams
We are currently working through a blend of in-person interactions (typically two days per week) and remote activity.
Operational Teams
Our operational teams are working on-site to ensure we can provide the highest level of service to our clients. We are taking the current guidance extremely seriously and are ensuring that the health, safety and well-being of our employees are at the highest standard.
Application Deadline
March 31, 2023
Department
Football
Employment Type
Contract
Location
Netherlands, Amsterdam
Workplace type
Onsite

Are you a Cloud Solution Architect who knows how to shape complex cloud projects from the scratch? And do you also like to get hands-on involvement when it comes to implementation and optimization? Or do you have a lot of experience in development and implementation and are ready to apply your skills and experience on a strategic level as well?
If this unique blended wiring sounds like you, then Mindcurv just might be the perfect place for you. We are a family-type, global company of tech consultants and executors with a rare DNA. Highly qualified experts who successfully handle challenging, hyper innovative IT-projects. From the very first discovery, till the project go-live and beyond. We are not the typical system integrator, and not the regular consultancy either. We do both. We do it simultaneously. And we do it as a team!
For us, being truly happy at work means loving our jobs, making an impact in projects, being held high for who you are, and having the opportunity to learn and grow. And that’s exactly what we offer you.
The setting
Within our Cloud Platforms Solution Line, we apply an agile approach to provide true on-demand cloud computing. We implement and operate secure cloud and hybrid global infrastructures using automation techniques for our clients business critical application landscape.
Your role
As a Mindcurv Cloud Solutions Architect you identify your customer’s business strategy and make sure we design and deliver the best fit solution. You’ll lead discovery sessions, translate them into technical solutions, and lead the tech team. Of course, all in close collaboration with client teams and colleagues.
What will you bring?
You are experienced in the above mentioned role, have already gathered extensive experience in cloud environments or bring an infrastructure background and the wish to expand your knowledge to the cloud
You already architected and implemented successful digital projects in Cloud or hybrid infrastructures
Performing in a customer facing context, preferably in eBusiness, was part of your daily business
You have experience with at least one of the three hyperscalers (AWS, Azure or GCP)
You have experience in working with development teams and are familiar with agile software delivery methods for web applications
Integration experience with complex heterogeneous systems environments
Experience with Service Oriented Architectures and Microservices
You aren’t a powerpoint architect ;-) You own your solutions, work with our clients and support our teams to see them properly implemented
What do we offer you?
Perks, like drinks and snacks, pizza sessions, gaming nights and sensational parties, a pension scheme and a great salary, we’ve got them all.
And if you crave an intellectual challenge, Mindcurv has you covered. Interesting projects involving the latest, hyper innovative tech. An agile, entrepreneurial environment, with lots of freedom and no politics. Work-life balance, a culture of transparency and a management team with their ears to the ground.
As we typically are the trailblazers and innovators, we’re working Remote First. A hybrid way of working in which you can work from home. You just come into one of our offices in Essen, Cologne, Düsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt a.M., Hamburg, Jena, Utrecht, Madrid, Cochin, Coimbatore or Trivandrum when it adds value to be on-site. Looking for a glance behind the scenes? Check this blog.
Our high performers
You know who really thrive with us? Self-starters, team-players and continuous learners, with an uncanny ability to handle ambiguity. We’ll equip you with everything you need to succeed, help you explore the length and breadth of your domain and provide you with constant growth opportunities, to enrich your career.
Ready for change?
Are you ready for the next step in your career? For a role in which you can be fully yourself and bring out the best? In yourself, your colleagues and your clients? Don’t wait any longer and apply for this job right now.
About Mindcurv
At Mindcurv, we shape the future of digital. We help our customers rethink their digital business, experiences, and technology to navigate the new digital reality. By designing sustainable and accountable solutions for humans living in a digital world. By taking ownership, being proactive and pragmatic.

At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste.

As the world’s largest food waste-fighting app, we connect stores that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who buy and enjoy it. Our community of 73 million users has saved more than 198 million meals from going to waste across 17 countries, but there’s still a lot more we want to achieve.

Globally, more than a third of food is wasted, and climate experts agree that combating food waste is one of the most important things we can do to address the climate crisis. For us, it’s simple: the bigger we get, the better placed we’ll be to make a huge difference.

That means we’re looking for talented people with diverse skills and backgrounds to join us in the fight against food waste. That is where you come in: we’re looking for an exceptional Global Public Affairs Manager to join us in our Amsterdam office and create, develop and implement a Public Affairs strategy for The Netherlands primarily, as well as for the rest of our Cluster North (Belgium, Denmark, Sweden, and Norway).

Your Mission:

As Public Affairs Manager, your mission will be to protect & strengthen Too Good To Go’s right to operate as a social impact company. You will also make sure that policymakers raise the bar when designing and implementing policy measures to reduce food waste, by continuously telling the story of the enormous environmental, social and economic impact of food waste and supporting them in coming forward with regulatory measures to save food from being wasted.

Our global Public Affairs team works in close cooperation with the global Legal team, and with local and global PR and Communications teams. As a member of the Global Public Affairs team, you will report to the Global Public Affairs Director.


Your Role:

Defining and implementing the advocacy strategy to influence food waste legislation and broader policy landscape relevant to Too Good To Go in in The Netherlands and four other Cluster North countries
Devising and implementing stakeholder engagement programmes, building and maintaining a solid network amongst relevant stakeholders from political parties, NGOs, associations…
Advising on how to handle high profile political situations; delivering the appropriate message to each stakeholder, and defining the right level of engagement (dialogue, influence, partnership)
Scanning political, reputational and regulatory risks & opportunities in areas of food waste, sustainable food systems, digital platforms, packaging, consumer information
Leading Too Good To Go’s contribution to relevant consultations and forums; drafting position papers
Representing Too Good To Go with political authorities and institutions, serving as the first point of contact for their inquiries
Act as spokesperson on policy issues, and represent the company in relevant policy conferences, events, panels and speaking engagements
Running campaigns and cross-functional projects to advance our mission


What we are looking for:

You have a degree in Political Science, Public Policy, International Relations or Law
You already have several years of experience in policy advocacy roles, NGOs or government, and a record of successful campaigns and political decision-making influence in The Netherlands, or elsewhere
You have a clear understanding of the Dutch political landscape as well as a good knowledge of the country’s sustainability & environmental policy issues, preferably also in the area of food waste (policy knowledge in a Scandinavian market is a plus)
You have proven ability to influence, manage, build and improve relationships with stakeholders from politics, business, and civil society
You have excellent written & verbal communication and negotiation skills, with rigorous English and Dutch (proficiency in Danish, Swedish or Norwegian is a plus)
You are someone who enjoys deep-diving into emerging topics, political trends, upcoming regulations, and challenges
You are a self-starter with a high level of initiative who functions autonomously and has a collaborative mindset.
You understand the added value that public affairs brings to a company’s operational success, and proactively seek to build internal relations


Our Values:

We fight together: food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we fight together as Food Savers with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam
We raise the bar: we always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another
We keep it simple: our ambitions are bold, but our solutions are simple
We build a legacy: we’re proud of the change we’re driving
We care: we always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business


What we offer:

A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change
The experience of being part of an international company with over 1350 enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across numerous countries – always ready to share knowledge and support
Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment
An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together

How to apply

We are passionate about recruitment and grateful for your interest! Please carefully read everything written above and check out our website and international media to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your Resume and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. Resumes and/or Cover Letters will not be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.
The application process consists of a short video call with Talent Acquisition, followed by an interview with the hiring manager, a case study and a final interview with the Hiring team.

Too Good To Go is an equal opportunity employer

Job Ref - #LI-CR1

Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
As a Sales Development Representative at Veeva, you will join a highly accelerated two-year path toward a long-term sales career at Veeva. This accelerated sales track is comprised of two distinct phases:
Phase 1: You’ll work as a Sales Development Representative (SDR). We’ll teach you about the Life Sciences industry and SaaS technology. You’ll generate sales demand and pipeline revenue through inbound and outbound prospecting. This job will help you build both foundational sales skills and an authentic sales approach.
Phase 2: You will be promoted to Associate Account Partner and aligned to a sales team and sales manager. In this role, you will continue prospecting, which will become the basis for your territory as an Account Partner. You will also shadow top-performing Account Partners to learn how they succeed and to understand the full deal cycle from lead to renewal.

We will invest in your learning and growth, with formal education, peer-to-peer activities, and support, including coaching, and mentoring. Upon successful completion of these two phases, you will be promoted to an Account Partner position in our Field Sales organization and positioned for a great and long-term career in Sales.
You must be based in the Netherlands and legally authorized to be employed in the European Union. Veeva does not provide sponsorship for an employment visa for this position.
What You’ll Do
Work within a defined territory to generate and qualify new leads and opportunities
Research and develop a plan for breaking into your assigned accounts
Partner closely with a sales team and account executives to advance and close your opportunities over time
Build trusted relationships with prospective customers, understand their needs and recommend the right Veeva products and solutions
Rapidly develop your sales skills on the job and through training and events
Requirements
3+ years of professional experience related to sales within a fast-paced environment
Full business language capacity in English and Dutch
BA or BS Degree in a technical major (STEM, Economics, Accounting, etc.) with solid academic performance
Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills with the ability to build rapport quickly
Self-starter, entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to take initiative
Highly organized, can manage time and multiple priorities effectively
Team player. Able to take accountability and direction
Resilience to rejection
Willingness to travel as needed (~25%)
Legally authorized to be employed in the European Union without limitations or restrictions
Nice to Have
Business proficiency in French
Experience in Consulting, Customer Success, or Project Management
Experience with Salesforce or other CRM systems
Experience or demonstrated interest in Life Sciences or Technology
Community involvement or organizational leadership experience
Evidence of competitive endeavors
Perks & Benefits
Allocations for continuous learning and development
Health and wellness programs
Personalized giving program
#RemoteNetherlands
Research has shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs, unless they meet every single requirement. So if you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply – even if you don’t meet every single point. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!
Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.
Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

job_titles: Associate Director of Strategy - Clinical Operations - EMEA (Remote)
job_description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
This role is responsible for the effective and coherent business and market-facing aspects of the Vault Clinical Operations Suite. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a team of Life Sciences industry and technology A-players, who, together, are modernizing clinical trial operations, supporting the Sponsor transition from paper to digital, and bringing the digital trials capabilities to the life sciences industry.
The Associate Director of Strategy, Vault Clinical Operations role requires an understanding of the global life sciences clinical operations space with an emphasis on Europe and clinical outsourcing. You will be responsible for growing Veeva’s Clinical Operations market share and adoption of Veeva Vault Clinical Operations Suite, such as eTMF, Clinical Trial Management System (CTMS), Study Start-Up (SSU), Payments, and SiteConnect products in xSMB – Small and Medium Size Businesses, with a focus on biotech accounts across Europe.
You will be responsible for our reference selling model for the SMB. The focus will be to help identify and win key deals supporting the sales team, facilitate Sponsor decisions on digital transformation, ensure product adoption by the customer base, play an ongoing role in senior-level customer discussions, and evangelize the product in public events.
This is a Work Anywhere role, meaning you can be based and work from anywhere within the Netherlands, as long as you are close to an airport and are able to meet travel requirements.
What You’ll Do
Grow and sustain the customer base
Provide thought leadership and sales support to internal teams
Provide business guidance to the product team
Develop strategy and messaging for customer adoption of applications, new features, and functionality
Coordinate resources across the customer lifecycle from sales to delivery and throughout
Ensure long-term post-implementation success
Present at industry conferences, lead webinars, and author articles for industry publications
Requirements
3+ years of experience working at Sponsor Clinical Operations or CROs or Strategy consulting firm in life sciences
3+ years of experience in business development with a proven track record – you need to be strongly familiar with sales
Strong consultative and analytical skills
Fast learner and flexible
Can work autonomously in a fast pace and multicultural environment
Strong collaboration skills
Team spirit
Ability to travel for customer meetings and presentations
Nice to Have
Experience in selling SaaS software
Evidence of industry presentations and/or publications
Additional European language knowledge
#RemoteNetherlands

We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

Job Function: Field Sales Why SoftwareONE?:

SoftwareOne is a leading global software and cloud solutions provider that is redefining how companies build, buy and manage everything in the cloud. By helping clients to migrate and modernize their workloads and applications – and in parallel, to navigate and optimize the resulting software and cloud changes – SoftwareOne unlocks the value of technology. The company’s 8,900 employees are driven to deliver a portfolio of 7,500 software brands with sales and delivery capabilities in 90 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, SoftwareOne is listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange under the ticker symbol SWON. Visit us at https://www.softwareone.com/en

The role:

As a Solution Specialist Future Workplace you will act as the key technical contact (presales overlay role) for our field sales team. You will demonstrate Microsoft technologies, execute quick feasibility assessments, scope technical and security design and develop proposals to meet customer needs. You will also illuminate the road to digital transformation by leading whiteboard session and customer presentations. To be successful, you will possess exceptional presentation, written and verbal skills. You should ideally be a subject matter expert in the Microsoft services portfolio.
Responsibilities:
Partners and co-owns sales activities at a customer level with the field-based account manager
Performance and success measured by GP performance of region and individual accounts
Analyze & gather business requirement from large & complex client environment and perform required research and investigation to identify and create thorough, accurate technical solution proposals based on client requirements
Responsible for partnering with Business Development Managers and local sales leadership to drive net new business opportunities within the existing regional account base as well as supporting customer acquisition activities as assigned
Provide support in proposals and RFP response in an extensive, formal and timely manner
Prepares cost estimates for licensing and product sales as well as professional services (deployment, migration, implementation, workshops, etc.) by studying blueprints, plans, and related customer documents; consulting with other engineers, architects, practice leads and other professional and technical personnel (both internal and external)
Develop overall solutions including high-level design (e.g.-Whiteboarding), statements of work, service design and bills of materials
Input appropriate information into CRM tools
Review customer requirements and recommend options and solutions that meet customer’s business goals and directives
Contributes to account business plan development
Develop relationships and act as liaison to local partners (VARs, publishers, distribution, etc.) to ensure available resources are being utilized where appropriate
Act as a technical evangelist for marketing activities including speaking/presenter engagements at conferences, conventions, user groups, webinars, etc.
Partner with stakeholders and drive solution marketing activities by preparing and delivering content and messaging
Represent SoftwareONE in the market with a high standing reputation
Maintain and report on regional service delivery, sales pipeline, and project status
Maintain and acquire advanced level technical certification in assigned area and maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies
What we need to see from you:
Experience in Microsoft 365 solutions (Future Workplace).
Proficient with Microsoft user identity management solutions
Microsoft Office 365 Security Solutions (experience with Cisco security solutions a plus)
Enterprise Voice/Unified Collaboration experience strongly desired
Microsoft Flow and PowerApps experience beneficial
Ability to communicate the value of the solution in terms of financial return, differentiating value and impact on customer technical and business goals·
Excellent Computer Skills; Word, Excel, outlook, MS Teams, etc.
Entrepreneurial Mindset as we constantly challenge ourselves in our mindset, portfolio and services
Ability to effectively manage multiple field sales resources and/or engagements
Ability to work within tight timeframes
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Open-minded, passion to learn and share, flexible thinker
Motivated, approachable, and positive team influence
Travel required up to 20%
What we have to offer:
A career within an innovative company with a unique corporate culture
Top rating on glassdoor/kununu
The option to work partially from home (hybrid) from office
A variety of training and development opportunities
We trust you - our working hours are flexible and not recorded!
A work-life balance with unlimited vacation days
With our employee share and recommendation program, you benefit from our success.
Top technical equipment for your new job!
No dress code - wear what you feel comfortable in!
Have we piqued your interest?
If yes, we are looking forward to receiving your CV. Please use our online form to apply.
If you have any questions, please write me an e-mail at malte.ruetten@softwareone.com.
#LI-MR32
#LI-remote
What you should really know about us.:

Strip away everything. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful.

Passionate people who live and breathe our values every day, who delight our customers, every day, and who go above and beyond, every day. Our culture is unique, and I believe that having the right people, and empowering them to succeed, is the absolute key to our success.
Patrick Winter, Founder.
What we expect from our employees:

Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. SoftwareONE employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics.

Our leaders operate with a high levels of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy.

Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
We are an AI team supporting the entire suite of link data products (e.g., Link Key People). Agility and quality are our operating principles in developing cutting-edge ML models. Our ML models are trained by data captured by a massive group of over 1600 subject-matter experts. ML models complement the curational pipeline and scale our solutions to different regions, languages, and therapeutic areas. Ultimately, we accelerate clinical trials and equitable care. We are proud that our work helps patients to get their most urgent care sooner. See us in this video and learn why you may prefer to join us here.
What You’ll Do
Technical lead for ML-Ops
Develop and manage ML infrastructures and CICD pipelines to support multiple data products
Provide engineering mentorship and guidance to data-scientists
Collaborate with ML engineers, data scientists, data engineers, and product and operation teams
Develop, integrate, and optimize end-to-end AI pipelines by a data-driven approach
Build fully automated, scalable, cost-effective, and fault-tolerant solutions in AWS to process billions of records
Collaborate with data quality teams to build data annotation/evaluation pipelines, monitoring, and dashboards
Requirements
Strong collaboration skills as well as verbal and written communication skills
Professional in ML Operationalization, including workflow/model management platforms such as Airflow/MLflow
4+ years of experience in professional software development
2+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or relevant jobs
2+ years of experience in cloud development
Solid programming skills in Python
Great skills in Data Engineering and big data technologies such as Spark
Up-to-Date knowledge of the latest ML innovations and frameworks
Strong analytical skills and data curiosity
This position is listed identically as remote work in Germany and Netherlands. Before applying, you must already live in the above countries and be legally authorized to work there without requiring Veeva’s support for a visa. If you need a Visa, plan to relocate, or intend to work in a nearby country, please submit an additional document explaining your exceptional situation.
Nice to Have
Experience in the life/health science industry, notably pharma
Experience in containerization, Kubernetes, and relevant distributed computing for training and inference
Experience with NoSQL databases
Familiarity with architectural choices, particularly for ML systems
Leadership skills and a solid network to help in hiring and growing the team
Perks & Benefits
Work anywhere
Personal development budget
Annual budget to donate to the non-profit of your choice
Health & wellness programs
Life insurance

About Mindcurv
We help our customers rethink their digital business, experiences, and technology to navigate the new digital reality. We do this by designing sustainable and accountable solutions for humans living in a digital world. Mindcurv holistically covers the market's need to digitalise business processes and customer experiences and take advantage of the cloud following DevOps and agile principles.
Within Cloud Infrastructure & Managed Services our agile approach gives true on-demand cloud computing. At Mindcurv we adopted DevSecOps and IaC practices. Our aspiration is to automate everything that can be automated with the aim to have self-managing systems.
Your role
As an Infrastructure Developer (f/m/d) you are responsible for implementing on cloud, on premise and hybrid global infrastructures using automation techniques and infrastructure-as-code. Your responsibilities will include:
Automation of infrastructure provisioning, configuration, maintenance and orchestration processes
Supporting the infrastructure design process
Automation of deployment processes
Implementing reliable monitoring systems
Implementing system and data backup and recovery procedures
Producing documentation for infrastructure maintenance and operations
Transferring knowledge to the Operations Team
System performance tuning and general improvements
System troubleshooting
Examples of typical technologies/methods we use (please note, this can change rapidly and be quite different in accordance to the project):
Linux/Unix Administration and Linux based private cloud infrastructure
Automation/configuration management
AWS (EC2, VPC, EBS, ELB, S3, RDS, Route53, DynamoDB)
Creating and maintaining Docker images
CI/CD tool handling in Jenkins
PHP applications like Magento, Typo3 - LAMP Stack
Monitoring Tools like Sensu, Nagios, ELK-Stack
Who you are
You have practical experience in implementation of multiple projects in one of the main cloud flavour (AWS, Azure, GCP)
You are experienced in the above described role as well as the above mentioned technologies
You enjoy working in an international and agile environment
You are used to switching between the English and Dutch language while surrounded by different languages (Dutch not mandatory)
What do we offer you?
Perks, like drinks and snacks, pizza sessions, gaming nights and sensational parties, a pension scheme and a great salary, we’ve got them all.
And if you crave an intellectual challenge, Mindcurv has you covered. Interesting projects involving the latest, hyper innovative tech. An agile, entrepreneurial environment, with lots of freedom and no politics. Work-life balance, a culture of transparency and a management team with their ears to the ground.
As we typically are the trailblazers and innovators, we’re working Remote First. A hybrid way of working in which you can work from home. You just come into one of our offices in Essen, Cologne, Düsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt a.M., Hamburg, Jena, Utrecht, Madrid, Cochin, Coimbatore or Trivandrum when it adds value to be on-site. Looking for a glance behind the scenes? Check this blog.
Our high performers
You know who really thrive with us? Self-starters, team-players and continuous learners, with an uncanny ability to handle ambiguity. We’ll equip you with everything you need to succeed, help you explore the length and breadth of your domain and provide you with constant growth opportunities, to enrich your career.
Ready for change?
Are you ready for the next step in your career? For a role in which you can be fully yourself and bring out the best? In yourself, your colleagues and your clients? Don’t wait any longer and apply for this job right now.
About Mindcurv
At Mindcurv, we shape the future of digital. We help our customers rethink their digital business, experiences, and technology to navigate the new digital reality. By designing sustainable and accountable solutions for humans living in a digital world. By taking ownership, being proactive and pragmatic.
9sBRzGI1Lu

Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
Link is a pillar in the Veeva system landscape that envisions “Connecting life sciences and key people to improve research and care.”Our product offers real-time academics, social, and medical data to build comprehensive profiles. These profiles help our life-science industry partners find the right experts to accelerate the development and the adoption of new therapeutics. We accelerate clinical trials and equitable care. We are proud that our work helps patients receive their most urgent care sooner.
Your analysis will shape the product roadmap for a new Link product focused on clinical trials. You will design and create an end-to-end pipeline to extract predefined categories of information from big unstructured data in multi-domain and multi-lingual setups. You will have access to cloud infrastructure to develop your model and support from a team of software developers and DevOps engineers to deploy it to production.
We want to develop new algorithms to redefine the industry expectations for quality vs. quantity compromise. We train ML models empowered by over 1200 curators to meet both the quality and the scale requirements. ML models complement and learn from continuous curation and scale our solutions to different regions, languages, and medical specialties.
You can work remotely anywhere in the Netherlands, but you have to live in the Netherlands and be legally authorized to work there without requiring Veeva’s support for visa or relocation. If you do not meet this condition, but you think you are an exceptional candidate please clarify it in a separate note and we will consider it.
What You’ll Do
Develop machine learning models at scale and in AWS cloud to structure and analyze scientific data
Adopt the latest technologies and trends in AI to your platform
Use and develop named entity recognition, entity-linking, slot-filling, few-shot learning, active learning, dense passage retrieval and other statistical techniques and models for information extraction and machine reading
Deeply understand and analyze our data model per data source and geo-region and interpret model decisions
Collaborate with data quality teams to define annotation tasks, metrics, and perform qualitative and quantitative evaluation
Collaborate with engineering teams to implement models at terminal scale
Requirements
4+ years of experience as a data scientist (or 2+ years with a Ph.D. degree)
Fluent in Python/Java and experience with bashing script
Strong analytical skills and data curiosity
Good English and strong communication skills
Experience in at least one framework for BigData (e.g. Spark, DASK) and one framework for Deep Learning (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch)
Mastery of Machine Learning, including up-to-date knowledge of latest ML innovations and frameworks
Used to start-up environments
Social competence and a team player
High energy and ambitious
Agile mindset
Nice to Have
Background in clinical (trial) data
Experience in life/health science industry, notably pharma
Having published in AI space in a peer-reviewed journal
Production-grade development Skills
Cloud development, especially AWS
Experience in NLP, NER, deduplication, entity-linking, or graph-processing
Leadership skills and a solid network to help in hiring and growing the team
Experience in containerization, Kubernetes and relevant distributed computing for training and inference
Experience with NoSQL databases, especially MongoDB
Familiarity with model registry solutions such as MLflow
Perks & Benefits
Work anywhere
Personal development budget
Veeva charitable giving program
Fitness reimbursement
Life insurance + pension fund
#RemoteNetherlands
Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.
Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

Careers
Field Sales Director
DACH
Apply
Position Summary

As the Field Sales Director for a territory, you will lead all activities related to defining and implementing a Business Development plan in your designated territory. You should have extensive experience in sales and business development as well as the ability to identify and cultivate technical alignment with technical buyers. You should have 5-10 years of proven sales success within the software industry selling enterprise solutions. Your strong interpersonal skills and ability to multitask in a fast-growing environment will be critical to working closely with your colleagues to successfully navigate a complex sales process.

Responsibilities
New Business Development
Identify and qualify opportunities for Pyramid Analytics Software platform for Enterprise Customers
Develop a 3x-5x 12-month pipeline of qualified opportunities to meet and exceed your quota targets.
Ability to identify the decision-makers, and influencers with target customers as well as to develop strategies to navigate complex organizational politics to win business.
Plan approaches and pitches. Work with team to develop proposals that speak to the client’s needs, concerns, and objectives.
Manage the closing process including negotiations, terms, and conditions as well as procurement activities.
Present a professional and polished image that mirrors that of the client.
Maintain a current and accurate pipeline at every stage of maturity. Must have the ability to create a forecast that is a highly reliable view of your business.
Direct accountability to meet or exceed your quarterly and annual sales quota on a consistent basis.
Present new products and services and enhance existing relationships with assigned account lists.
Work with technical staff and other internal colleagues to meet customer needs to promote customer satisfaction and retention.
Arrange and participate in internal and external client briefings.
Business Development Planning
Attend industry functions, such as association events and conferences, and provide feedback and information on market trends as well as competitors.
Present to and consult with senior level management on business trends with a view on developing new services, products, and distribution channels.
Identify opportunities for campaigns, services, and distribution channels that will lead to revenue growth.
Using your industry expertise of the market and competitors, create sales messaging that communicates the company’s unique selling propositions and differentiators.
Competencies
Proven track record of meeting/exceeding revenue/quota targets
Demonstrated ability to build and manage customer/executive relationship
Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
Demonstrated ability to manage complex sales cycles including the ability to provide coordination and direction to your extended team
Experience and training in a value-based methodology (solution selling, customer-centric selling, etc.)
Proven prospecting and sales cycle management skills
Travel

This position may require up to 50% travel

Required education and experience
5+ years minimum experience in a direct/indirect enterprise software sales role
Experience selling analytics or business intelligence solutions
Experience subscription software sales
Preferred Education and Experience
Bachelors or master’s degree in Business or Technology
Additional Eligibility Qualifications

None required for this position

Marketing & Sales medewerker (m/v/d)
PTV. The mind of movement
PTV Group. Empowering mobility.

The PTV Group provides software and consulting to empower mobility and transport for a cleaner and smarter future. Its best-in-class software for intelligent traffic management and transport optimization enables decision-makers in politics, cities, industry, and trade save time and money, make roads safer, and protect the environment. PTV runs simulations to demonstrate today how tomorrow’s mobility, with all its ecosystems and dimensions, can be realized. From strategic transport planning to micromobility for the last mile.
The company was established in 1979. Today, approximately 900 employees worldwide work on future-oriented solutions to create intelligent and eco-friendly mobility for everyone.

Voor onze Marketing, Sales & Communicatie afdeling zijn wij op zoek naar een Marketing & Sales medewerker (m/v/d). Binnen deze functie help jij onze organisatie én onze oplossingen betreft rit- en routeplanning verder op de kaart te zetten! Je bent het eerste aanspreekpunt voor klanten & prospecten. Daarnaast genereer en kwalificeer je leads via outbound (telefoon, social media, evenementen) activiteiten maar volg je ook leads op via inbound marketing activiteiten. De uitdaging? Leads converteren naar afspraken voor Sales.

Waar ben je goed in?
Leads genereren via outbound activiteiten.
Het maken van sales afspraken.
Relaties opbouwen en onderhouden met potentiële klanten.
Luisteren naar potentiële klanten en zo vraag en aanbod samen brengen.
Al je contact momenten netjes en geordend in ons CRM verwerken.
Wat vragen wij van jou?
Je hebt minimaal MBO niveau 4 afgerond.
Je hebt affiniteit met Marketing.
Je hebt ervaring met telefonische acquisitie.
Je kan goed samenwerken binnen een team.
Je bent 40 uur per week beschikbaar.
Het beheersen van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.
Hoe ga je dat doen?
Door actief ons netwerk te benaderen via telefoon, mail of marketing automation.
Door tijdens het gesprek aanknopingspunten te vinden om een commerciële afspraak te maken.
Door samen te werken en te leren van je team genoten.
Door actief bij te dragen aan onze marketing activiteiten.
Maar vooral door plezier te hebben in je werk.
Waarom bij PTV Group?
Informele sfeer.
Korte lijnen binnen de organisatie.
50 werknemers.
No-nonsense cultuur.
Opleidingsmogelijkheden.
Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Wens je meer info? Bel ons: +31 346 581 600

Link is a pillar in the Veeva system landscape that envisions “Connecting life sciences and key people to improve research and care.” Our product offers real-time academics, social, and medical data to build comprehensive profiles. Online Marketeer (m/v/d)
PTV. The mind of movement
PTV Group. Empowering mobility.

The PTV Group provides software and consulting to empower mobility and transport for a cleaner and smarter future. Its best-in-class software for intelligent traffic management and transport optimization enables decision-makers in politics, cities, industry, and trade save time and money, make roads safer, and protect the environment. PTV runs simulations to demonstrate today how tomorrow’s mobility, with all its ecosystems and dimensions, can be realized. From strategic transport planning to micromobility for the last mile.
The company was established in 1979. Today, approximately 900 employees worldwide work on future-oriented solutions to create intelligent and eco-friendly mobility for everyone.

Wat ga je doen?
Wordt jouw werk leuker als je het creatieve én strategische brein van het marketing team bent? Bij PTV Group zijn we op zoek naar een fulltime Online Marketeer (m/v/d). Je weet als geen ander hoe je digital marketing funnels kan inzetten, zodat alle marketingkanalen up and running zijn. Dankzij jou komen de mooiste ideeën naar voren om campagnes naar een volgend level te brengen. Heb jij ervaring als Online Marketeer (m/v/d)? Solliciteer dan direct!

Jouw rol als Online Marketeer
Met jouw inzicht en vaardigheden weet je direct hoe je het onderste uit de kan kan halen. Je werkt veel samen met het marketingteam, aangezien jij weet hoe je online marketing funnel kan optimaliseren. Door jouw inzet kunnen we onze maximale groei behalen en wordt je de meest geliefde collega binnen het bedrijf.

Wat je gaat doen?
Optimaliseren en beheren van online marketing activiteiten en kanalen (SEO, SEA, Marketing Automation, Content Marketing, Social Media Marketing).
Je denkt mee over mogelijke verbeteringen voor het online marketing plan.
Beheren van onze tools waar gebruik van wordt gemaakt (SEMrush, Eloqua, Google Ads, Analytics, LeadInfo).
Websitebeheer (WordPress & Typo3).
Wie we zoeken?
Je duikt graag in de marketing tools en ziet kansen om ze te optimaliseren.
Je hebt kennis van B2B SEA, SEO, Social Advertising.
Kennis van Adobe is een pré.
Je bent breed geïnteresseerd in alles op het gebied van online marketing & inbound marketing. Je houdt ervan om in trends te duiken, waardoor je weer je creatieve brein aan het werk zet om nieuwe online marketing campagnes uit te rollen met het team.
Je weet in te schatten wat prioriteit heeft.
Je ziet ruimte voor verbeteringen op lange en korte termijn.


Wat wij vragen:
Minimaal mbo werk- en denkniveau.
Ongeveer minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring (relevante werkervaring tellen ook).
Je bent een aanpakker en kan goed prioriteiten stellen.
Je hebt kennis van SEA, SEO, Social Advertising.
Kennis van Adobe is een pré.
Wat wij bieden
Een fulltime baan voor 40 uur in de week.
Werken in een klein, wendbaar en flexibel team.
Meebouwen aan een hard groeiend bedrijf.
Gezellige uitjes met het team.
